Notes: Initialn-in South Parji is unclear; quite obviously, it cannot be of archaic origin.
The Naikri-Naiki forms are somewhat unclear (what is Naikibāy?)
External data shows*-v-to be original. Both variants were probably free, with*-v->*-m-due to expressive character of the form.

Additional forms: Parji and Salur forms go back to*āv-kum(second component unclear), while the Kondekor form is comparable with Teluguāviri.
Also Kolamisikip-(sikipt-) id. (tr.); (Pat.)sikkengto get stuck; Parjicirkip-(cirkit-) to trap, snare

Word: sēmpap- "to become ready to be milked"

Notes: Contamination is certain here, although the exact meanings of both roots is hard to determine. While  on first sight it would be natural to assume the meaning 'spleen' for*kaṭ-and 'hard' for*gaṭ-, this hardly seems convenient considering that in some SDR and Gondwan languages it is just the opposite. There's also a possibility of devoicing in Naikri through assimilation.

Word: guḍiya "a small field for cultivation of vegetables"
kadur "an instrument used to spin threads from cotton"

Additional forms: Also Parjikopp-to be full;kopip-(kopit-) to fill up;kopafull;koppasmall hillock; Ollarikopehill, forest; Gadba_S3kopup-to fill (tr.);koppenfull
Notes: Evidence for two roots here, indeed, confirmed by external data.

Word: kūrk- (kūruk-) "to sleep briefly, take a nap"

Additional forms: Also Parjicirḍip-(cirḍit-) to make to turn;cirḍukuḍcircuit, roundabout way;cirl-to revolve;cirlip-(cirlit-) to make to revolve; Salur caus.sirlap-; Gadba_S3silurp-id. (tr.)
Also Parjimuṛd-to lie flat on the face;muṛtip-(muṛtit-) to cause to lie flat on the face, turn upside down;muṛdilprone

Notes: A very strange suffix in Parji; maybe the original form was *muḍḍ-s?

Additional forms: Also Kolamimuggurthree men;muyalthree women;mūnd ulthree days; Naikrimuggurthree men;muyaḷthree women; Naikimug/g/urthree men;muy/y/athree women;munḍiḍathree times;mū nānthree days; Parjimūvirthree men;muyalthree women; adj.muy; Gadba_S3mūṇuthree;muvurthree (masc.);muyalthree (fem.)
Also Naikrinaṛmutin the middle; Naikiaḍmunin the middle; Parjinaṛbulin the middle
Also Parjinava jerijoke, joking;navip-(navit-) to cause to laugh
Also Naikiilup-/ilp-to make to stand; Parjinitip-(nitit-) to make to stand
Also Naikrioyip-to cause pain; Parjinoykuḍpain;nōmbir,nōmirfever, illness

Also Kolami_Kinpasapturmeric; Kolami_SRpasāpginger; Kolami_Kinpaccik panunripe fruit;paytbile; (Pat.)passiwet; Naikripaytbile; Parji (?)paryopyellow;paryop, (S)paryepturmeric; Salurpasūrraw; Gadba_S3ākupacangreen;pacca-pīrugreen rass;pasurgreen of leaf; Ollari (?)parepturmeric

Word: pārs- (pāris-) "to scratch with fingernails or claws"

Additional forms: Also Kolamipāṭa, Naikripāṭa, Naikipāṭasong, Parjipāṭasong, story, word, language; Ollaripāṭesong; Salurpāṭeword

Word: pā̃se "left-over food from the previous day, spoiled food"

Additional forms: Also Kolamipēlip-(pēlipt-) to make (grain) to pop; (?) Parjipiḍ-(piṭṭ-) (boil)  bursts, (fire) splutters, explodes;piḍip-(piḍit-) to make to burst, (hen) hatches eggs,  pop rice;pinḍp-(pinḍt-) to break, extract (tooth)
Also Gadba_S3pirukp-to open (tr., like a book, packet)
Also Kolami (Haig)pōdēlāŋwest; Naikiportalfrom above;portunabove; Parjiil podiroof
Also Salurpogasursoot; Gadba_S3pōgatobacco;pogḍ-(poguḍ-) to fill with smoke
Also Parjicamip-(camit-) to make to go rotten
Also Kolamisasi-(sasit-) to leave (say-+sī-to give); Parji (S)cāypip-(cāypit-) to cause to leave, wean; Gadba_S3sāyupp-to heal a wound

Notes: Impossible to determine the initial consonant because of irregular correspondences.

Additional forms: Also Parjitirk-to shudder, throb (pulse);tirbir-,tirbir er-to tremble
Also Kolamitōrndal(pl.tōrndasil) younger sister; Naikritōrndal(pl.tōrndaśil,tōrndaśikuḷ) sister; Naikitōndsister, mother's sister's daughter; Ollaritōnḍkinsman; Salurtōnḍudsister
Also Parjiutip-(utit-), (NE)uṭip-(uṭit-) to make to hang;utka, (NE)uṭkaropes of carrying-yoke; Gadba_S3uṭp-(uṭup-) to hang (tr.)

Also Kolamiunip-(unipt-) to make to drink, not giving with one's own hand;urt-(urutt-), (Kin.)ūrt-to give to drink, giving with one's own hand; Naikriūrt-to feed, give to drink; Parjiunṭip-to cause to drink; Salurunḍkefood, (P) pej
Notes: The retroflex nature of the consonant is seen primarily from the past stem (*unḍ-<*uṇ-t-) and derivatives, while intervocally*-ṇ->-n-.

Additional forms: Also Kolamiudip-(udipt-) to make to sit; Naikriudip-to make to seat; Naikiudup-/udp-to make to sit; Parjiuntip-(untit-) to cause to sit; Gadba_S3uṇup-to seat

Notes: It is not excluded that the root should be reconstructed as*ṛup-with a protheticu-in Parji.

Additional forms: Also Kolamiūpa swing; (Wagh.)ūp-to swing (tr.); Naikriūp-to hang up, swing (tr.);ūsea swing; Parjiūcip-(ūcit-) to swing (tr.);ūcal(pl.ūcacil) a swing, cradle; (S)ū̃g-to hang, swing;ūkip-(ūkit-) to cause to hang or swing
Also Kolamivaŋgip-(vaŋgipt-),vap-(vapt-) to bend (tr.); Parjivaŋgip-(vaŋgit-) to bend (tr.)
Also Gadba_S3vāŋp-(vāŋup-) to make to flow out
Also Parjivārp-(vārt-) to strain; Gadba_S3vārp-(vārup-) to filter (like boiled rice, etc.)
